description: From Middle English *langsumliche, from Old English langsumlīċe (“long, during or for a long time; patiently, with long-suffering”), equivalent to longsome +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: longsomely (comparative more longsomely, superlative most longsomely)

entries.meaning: In a longsome, long-lasting, or tedious manner; lengthily.
